title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 302.12 - Emergency vehicles
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 302.12 - Emergency vehicles

State Regulations

Upon the approach of any ambulance, police or fire department
vehicle or any authority emergency vehicle, giving audible signal by bell, siren or exhaust whistle, all traffic shall proceed as near as possible to the
right hand curb on the roadway and stop unless and until otherwise directed by
a member of the toll force, a police officer, or until such traffic shall have
passed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21

302.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
